IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To understand key processes driving the world's ocean ecosystems, their evolution and their fundamental relationship to life on earth through interrelated research, education, and technology transfer programs.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To understand key processes driving the world's ocean ecosystems, their evolution, and their fundamental relationship to life on earth through interrelated research, education, and technology transfer programs.
IRS990.Desc: Providing scientific and educational research for governmental, commercial, and educational entities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Laboratory houses the Provasoli-Guillard National Center of Marine Algae and Microbiota. The Laboratory does not capitalize this collection of more than 2,700 strains of marine phytoplankton, bacteria, and viruses. The Laboratory holds the collection for educational and research purposes; the strains are available to the public. Proceeds from the sales of strain samples are used to maintain and preserve the collection.

The Laboratory qualifies as an organization exempt from federal income tax under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and files a Form 990 tax return. With few exceptions, the Laboratory is no longer subject to U.S. federal income tax examinations by tax authorities for years before 2018 due to the statute of limitations. The Laboratory has adopted the provisions of FASB ASC, Income Taxes. Management of the Laboratory believes it has no material uncertain tax positions, and accordingly it will not recognize any liability for unrecognized tax benefits.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: To refinance debt held with First National Bank

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Bigelow has agreed with Block Island Marine Funding, Inc., a non-profit corporation that promotes the education of children through programs in marine science and marine biology, to encourage boat owners wishing to donate a boat to Bigelow to instead donate the boat to Block Island, and Block Island would arrange for the charter or sale of the boat as soon after the donation as reasonably practicable in compliance with IRS rules and regulations and remit 75% of the proceeds, less reasonable expenses, to Bigelow.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Barbara Burgess and Bill Burgess are married.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A copy is provided to all members of the Board before filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy is articulated to staff, updated annually, and reviewed by the Chief of Staff to monitor compliance.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The compensation committee hired an independent consultant and used 3rd party salary data from AIRI, which contains job descriptions and salary information from like-organizations. This data set was reviewed by the 3rd party consultant and salary bands were updated based on the review and an internal analysis using the same data set. Results were then further reviewed and discussed internally in the compensation committee and salary adjustments were made in accordance with the study.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Bigelow publishes governing documents and financial reports on its website. The conflict of interest policy is circulated regularly and hand-delivered to employees, volunteers, board members, and board committees.
The Audit Committee assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit and selection of an independent accountant.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part IV, Section C, Line 19:
